title: Keeping Children Safe In Education Statutory Guidance 2023 / REF LA F 5

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,/ REF LA F 5
This request relates to Keeping Children Safe In Education Statutory Guidance 2023 , sections 176-179, published on 6th June 2023 and effective from 1st September 2023.
Please supply me with copies of any correspondence since 1st April 2023 to the present ( including emails) sent to the schools in your area from the Local Authority, relevant to their implementation of the sections listed above .
Yours faithfully,
John Ormerod

Dear John Ormerod,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Keeping Children Safe In Education Statutory 2023 which we received on 15/10/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for your request is 944212.
You have asked us what information we hold relating to Keeping Children Safe In Education Statutory Guidance 2023 and we have requested information from Andrew Jones, Director of Education and Skills; Meredith Dixon-Teasdale, Strategic Director of Children's Services and Rosemary Ward, Strategic Commissioning Manager. They have all returned no information about this guidance. This is likely to be because this guidance is sent directly to the heads of schools and colleges and it is for them to implement rather than the council. Therefore, we are unable to answer your request as it has been put to us.
If we have not understood your request or you would like to submit a different or associated request, please contact us again.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be found here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council requires you to include the following attribution statement: "Contains public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0."
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response. Of course we acknowledge and apologise for the significant delay in responding.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you can contact the Information Commissioner's Office. Please see
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [Sheffield City Council request email]
